attributes.action: Introduce more effective education on racial equality to the National Curriculum
attributes.additional_details:
England’s loss at the 2020/1 Euros highlighted a far deeper problem in society. Multiple players were racially abused, and racial abuse on civilians has spiked. 

While racism in the UK is prevalent, it remains covert and often comes out in times like these, with perpetrators often using fake accounts. 

We must work at the grassroots level to ensure better racial and diversity education for the new generation to ensure they promote inclusion and tolerance, not just in the public eye.
attributes.background:
•Classes on racial equality, including various religions 
•Education on worldwide culture with focus on those with large UK immigrant populations
•Nationwide “crackdown” giving students the courage to report racial abuse and have it taken seriously 
•Minimum of 1 non-Christian religion taught

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see changes to the curriculum, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Your title refers to racial equality, but the main text of your petition requests a wide range of different changes to the curriculum. You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. You would need to ensure that the title of your petition covers the whole of your ask, and not just one aspect of it.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Decolonise the UK curriculum and make it more diverse: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/581666
